item.title: DPDK & FD.io
item.description: DPDK and FD.io are providing some kind of support for ARM.

item.title: GOLANG
item.description: GOLANG based Networking libraries usable in micro services in docker container to simulate VNF.

item.title: Linux Bridging
item.description: The first goal is to replace the NAT+DHCP on the worker nodes by Linux Bridging setup. All the devices connecting to the cluser (Wifi AP, Bluetooth or derectly through the internal switch would will be in the same IP network).

item.title: OVS
item.description: The second goal is to replace Linux Bridging with OVS. The setup will also use VLAN tagging on eth0 to seggrate kubernetes/pod traffic from “tenant/5g traffic.

item.title: OpenDayLight
item.description: The third is to implement SDN/Network Slicing using ODL and controlling OVS

item.title: Rebuild Calico for ARM32V7
item.description: Neither calico nor canal seems to be available for usage yet on ARM32V7 for PI. The attempt here is to cross-compile the calico containers and use them on the PI cluster. Since calico’s role is mainly to setup ip table to get Kubernetes POD-POD communication established, the likelyhood of being able to reuse some of calico go for a VNF are really slim.

item.title: Deploy Flannel in PI Cluster
item.description: In order to get the nodes and pods interface with each other accross the cluster. This post describes how I deployed Flannel acounting with the fact that some of the nodes have multiple interfaces (wlan0 and eth0).
